rec_room.api.endpoints.login_required(f: Callable) → Tuple¶

Wraps endpoint function f with a login requirement

Parameters

f (Callable function) – The function being called based on endpoint being reached (e.g., GET or POST)

Returns

HTML, HTTP status code, and HTTP JSON Headers

Return type

Tuple

rec_room.api.endpoints.logout() → None¶

Removes session data

rec_room.api.endpoints.render(endpoint: str, title: str, **kwargs: Dict) → Tuple[str, int, Dict]¶

Returns an HTTP response with HTML

Parameters

  • endpoint (str) – The endpoint being reached from the browser

  • title (str) – The text to be displayed on the browser’s tab

  • kwargs (dict) – Endpoint-specific arguments

Returns

HTML, HTTP status code, and HTTP JSON Headers

Return type

tuple

rec_room.api.endpoints.response(status: int, data: Dict = None) → Tuple[Dict, int, Dict]¶

Returns an HTTP response without HTML

Parameters

  • status (int) – HTTP status code

  • data (dictionary) – Arguments to return as part of response

Returns

JSON data, HTTP status code, and HTTP JSON Headers

Return type

tuple

Interface methods to Databases

add_user(user, **kwargs)¶

Add a user to the users database

add_profile(profile, **kwargs)¶

Add a user profile to the user profiles database

update_user(user, **kwargs)¶

Update a user’s information in the users database

update_profile(profile, **kwargs)¶

Update a user’s profile in the profiles database

get_users(**kwargs)¶

Return the users database

get_profiles(**kwargs)¶

Return the profiles database

get_semesters(**kwargs)¶

Return the semesters database

get_interests(**kwargs)¶

Return the interests database

add_user(user: Dict[str, str], **kwargs) → bool
